item.title: History | Exhibition about Vitória dos Allies in War II opens this month
item.description:
The exhibition that celebrates the anniversary of the victory of the allies and China against the Japanese occupation in the years of World War II will be inaugurated on the 25th. “For national liberation and world peace - exhibition of the 80th anniversary of the victory in the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and anti -fascist World War” takes place in the Macau Forum Building
The Macau Forum building hosts, from the 25th of this month, an exhibition that celebrates the 80th anniversary in which the allies have been winners of World War II and in which China managed to beat the Japanese who occupied parts of the territory, as well as Hong Kong, for a few years of the conflict. The show is named “for national liberation and world peace - exhibition of the 80th anniversary of the victory in the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and the anti -fascist World War” and aims to “recall the historical feat, honor the martyrs and extol the noble patriotic spirits”. It is a project organized by the Macao government and commemorative museum of the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression. The show can be seen until September 24, being open to group visits by marking. In addition, on September 20, a Symposium on this theme is on the small auditorium of the Cultural Center on this topic with the organization of the Cultural Institute and the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services. For this conference will be invited "experts and academics from the interior of China and Macao to address the historical significance of victory in the War of Resistance." Experts are Wang Xiaoli, professor at the Shaanxi Provincial Committee School of the Shaanxi CCP (Academy of Administration), Lam Fat Iam, professor and director at the Faculty of Human Sciences and Social Sciences at Macao Polytechnic University, as well as Lin Guangzhi, professor and director of the Institute of Social and Cultural Research at Macao University of Science and Technology. These will "share studies on the involvement of young patriots in the revolution and their convictions during the War of Resistance, as well as the achievements and contributions of all sectors of Macao society during the war." History History With regard to the exhibition, the history of this conflict is six parts, with names such as “the outbreak of war-rising by national salvation”, “resistance from the whole nation-fighting together against Japanese aggression”, “united as one-a common resolution against invaders”, “growing enthusiasm-the red resistance in Macao”, “fighting together against fascism-the main oriental battlefield” and the big victory-a great victory ” for national rejuvenation ”. With the use of “a large amount of historical images and videos”, it presents “the hard path of 14 years of the resistance war of the Chinese people elapsed between 1931 and 1945”. In addition, the show tells the story “of the support provided by various sectors of the Macao society in the fight against Japanese aggression through funds raising, disclosure of information about national salvation, aid refugees and participation in the front line”. This shows "the solidarity bond between the macao compatriots and the country's people, united by blood ties and a common destination." The inauguration of the exhibition takes place on 25 to 15h, and can be visited free of charge.

item.title: Iam | Licenses for Esplanads are returning
item.description:
The Institute for Municipal Affairs has accepted, since Friday and experimental, new requests for license for terraces. However, these can only work in the daytime, and should end at 21h and be able to open at 9am the next day. Restoration sector responsible applaud the measure
After a meeting with the Union of Associations of Macao Restoration and Beverages Owners, the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) has even decided to re -issue licenses to Esplanades, a process that had been suspended since 2009. The experimental license request can be made since last Friday, 15. However, there are many rules to comply with these restoration establishments or bars, starting with the fact that the terraces cannot work at night. It includes “the prohibition of the functioning of the terraces between 9 pm and 9am the next day”, given “the situation of the Esplanades of Anim'Arte Nam Van or Patio of Commander Mata e Oliveira”. In addition, “loud or other similar equipment that emit sound in the area of the terraces cannot be placed, taking into account the Environmental Noise Prevention and Control Law, describes the AMI in a note. It is up to the establishments of the establishments to “maintain the cleaning and hygiene of the terrace and the surrounding space, periodically cleaning the respective area during the operating period and immediately arranging the place after daily use”. "Stains should be removed from the floor and immediately remove all objects from the site after the daily closure" of the terraces. There are even rules for the size of the tables and chairs to put on the street, with a cost of 1,200 patacas for each square meter of space they occupy. Sector congratulations 16 years ago AMI has not attributed new licenses of terraces, and now it intends to do so "in order to optimize the business environment of Macao's small and medium-sized companies" and after "auscultation the opinions of the sector." However, to advance in this decision, “several factors such as the balance between the community environment and the life of the population” were taken into account. Given that this is an experimental period of license issuance, AMI promises to "constantly monitor effectiveness, creating favorable conditions to revitalize the community economy." However, Deputies Ngan Iek Hang, Cheung Kin Chung, and some counselors have shown in favor of this measure, saying that the most terraced creation can enrich the characteristics of Macao tourism. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, Cheung Kin Chung praised that the measure not only enriches the Macao cultural tourism industry, but also encourages the economic revitalization of community neighborhoods, constituting more support and a source of hope for the tourism sector. Already Ngan Iek Hang said that clearer guidelines should be made, and there must be a narrower communication with the sector. The deputy, linked to the General Union of Macao residents' associations, also warned that the supervision mechanism should be reinforced in order to ensure that there is no violation of the new rules of the terraces, regarding the noise and cleaning of spaces. For its part, the member of the Advisory Board for Municipal Affairs, Law Chong In, praised that the Esplanade format is very popular within China and foreign countries, not only spaces for restoration, but also cultural tourism.

item.title: GDP | MSAR ECONOMY grew by 5.1% in the second quarter
item.description:
Macao Gross Domestic Product grew 5.1 percent in the second quarter of the year, in homologous terms, supported by the increase of visitors in the territory. Extending the analysis at the first half of 2025, the official data show an annual increase of 1.8 percent of GDP
Between April and June this year, Macao Gross Domestic Product (GDP) increased by 5.1 percent compared to the same period last year. The GDP reached, in the second quarter, 100.39 billion patacas, "equivalent to 88.8 percent of the economic volume of the year 2019," said the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) in a statement. In the second quarter of 2025, the economy “grew again, due to the number of visitors increased by remarkably, which were attracted to a number of measures, and [the] private consumer expense if kept stable,” reads the same note. Global service exports specifies DSEC in the statement increased by 6 percent, in annual terms, "since the number of visitors in the Masters rose about 20 percent in the second quarter of this year." Exports of other tourist services rose 5.9 percent and game services grew 9.9 percent. With regard to foreign trade in goods, in the second quarter, exports and imports of goods fell 6.6 percent and 4.1 percent, respectively, compared to the same period of 2024. Extended perspective In terms of internal demand, in the quarter under analysis, the government's final consumer consumption and private consumer expense increased 1 percent and 0.3 percent, respectively, in annual terms. "Gross fixed capital formation decreased by 3.7 percent, due to the decrease in the number of private construction works, despite the 11.7 percent increase in investment in private sector equipment, of 19.9 percent in the investment in the construction of the public sector and 83 percent in investing in the public sector," he says. In a semiannual analysis, GDP rose 1.8 percent in the first six months of the year, when compared to the same period last year. Exports of services, government final consumer expense, private consumer consumer expense and fixed capital formation rose 1, 1.1, 0.3 and 1.8 percent, respectively, compared to the first half of 2024. During this period, the implicit deflator of GDP, which measures the global price variation, registered an annual drop of 0.5 percent, also referred to the DSEC.

item.title: Traffic | Law returns to stake zero and moves to the next legislature
item.description:
The revision of the Traffic Law returned to the drawer and the legislative process will have to start over in the new legislature. Under discussion since the government of Chui Sai On, the law returns to Estaca Zero, after the deputies concluded that the diploma was unable to be voted before the end of the seventh legislature
The revision of the road traffic law crossed the legislative agendas of Chui Executives Sai On, Ho Iat Seng and returned to the drawer in the first year of Sam Hou Fai at the head of the government. Last Friday, the Legislative Assembly (AL) table released a deliberation, signed by the Al, Kou Hoi In, where it is indicated that “the proposed law entitled 'Road Traffic Law' does not gather the requirements for voting by the plenary”. It is added that "after the term of this legislature, the government can renew the initiative when it understands timely." At the end of Chui's term Sai On, the government eventually removed the law from the agenda after demonstrations against the increase of fines. Following the extinction of demonstrations in the streets of Macao, the reform of the legislation that regulates traffic returned to the legislative agenda of the Ho IAT SENG Executive, but once again did not complete the process. Almost two decades after its entry into force in October 2007, the law has been the subject of many criticism and promises of updating. This time, the AL table indicates that the parliamentary committee responsible for analyzing in the specialty the law had August 7 as the initial period of appreciation set, a period that was extended until August 15, last Friday. In the two months preceding the end of the deadline, and the work of this legislature, Kou Hoi In will have contacted the government several times to be aware of the progress of the proposal. Age of reason Despite the contacts of the AL, the 1st Permanent Commission that analyzed the diploma, chaired by Ella Law, did not receive “the formal and conclusive alternative version and the work text and the initial version of the bill are immature”, is described in the text signed by Kou Hoi In. The opinion signed by the deputies of the 1st Permanent Commission highlights that 23 meetings were held to discuss the diploma in the specialty, 14 of which with the participation of government representatives. However, the complexity of the diploma eventually dictated its "death" in the specialty. The government proposed the revocation of 39 legal diplomas, including the current road traffic law, “which implied a large legislative planning.” The opinion points out that “taking into account the divergence of general public opinions on the changes of the law proposal, it is necessary to continue to seek consensus”, and that “the government has not yet answered the issues of the commission” and that the “new work text continues to present some problems of principle”.

item.title: AL | Sam Hou Fai enhances deputies' work for constitutional order
item.description:
At a dinner with all the deputies, before the election of the new Hemiciclo, the chief executive praised the work of legislators in safeguarding the “constitutional order of the sashers established by the Constitution and the Basic Law”. Among the deputies present was Ron Lam, removed from the next elections for not being faithful to masters and the basic law
On Friday, Sam Hou Fai offered a dinner to all the deputies of the 7th Legislature, which will end at the first meeting (in mid-October) of the new cast of legislators found in the next legislative elections. The Chief Executive toasted the deputies with praise and highlighted the successes achieved by the deputies, who "provide solid foundations for the new legislature", in the effective safeguard "of the constitutional order of the Misrece established by the Constitution and the Basic Law". According to a statement issued by the Social Communication Office, the ruler stressed that the deputies ensured “the effective and smooth functioning of the structure with the predominance of the Executive Power established by the Basic Law, always supported, collaborated and supervised the government in governance according to the law, effectively exercised the powers and functions attributed by the basic law”. Among the “fruitful results” of legislative work, Sam Hou Fai highlighted the “modernization of the legal system of masters”, namely the improvement of the legal regime of state security defense. All deputies participated in dinner, including those who are leaving. One of them was Ron Lam, who despite the compliments of Sam Hou Fai about the safeguard “of the constitutional order of the Mand to be established by the Constitution and the Basic Law”, was disqualified from the next elections allegedly because it is not true to MSAR and the Basic Law. In due place In total, during the four years of activity, the seventh legislature deputies approved 86 laws. In addition, Sam Hou Fai praised the works of deputies to “raise the governing capacity of mashes, the development of the proper diversification of the economy”, as well as me important areas for the well-being of the population. The chief executive indicated that in the last four years, the operation of the Legislative Assembly (AL) has provided "three important experiences and inspirations." The first was to ensure the firm implementation of the “Macao governed by Patriotas” principle. The second was the correct fulfillment of AL's functions and responsibilities to ensure the smooth functioning of the structure with the predominance of the executive branch. ” The third was the continuity of improving legislative efficiency and quality “to ensure the legal compliance of Macau's environment and prestige to the environment and prestige in law”. Finally, Sam Hou Fai said he hoped Kou Hoi In, Chui Sai Cheong and deputies who will leave office soon will continue to support the government in governance according to the law and contribute to efforts and suggestions for the development, prosperity and stability of the long run.

item.title: “Macao Memory” | FM accepts old images by the end of the year
item.description: The cultural and historical website “Memory of Macau”, created by the Macau Foundation, is six years old and thinking about this ephemeris is being asked to the public donation of old images of Macao. Thus, and until December 31 this year, the “Macao Memory Image Sharing Program” is due to “encourage residents to capture precious moments of life, subtle and moving moments, integrating their personal experiences into the city's collective memory, thus becoming an important part of Macau's cultural memory”. This program is open to all interested macao residents, whether professional or amateur photographers. The content of the subjected images should be related to Macau, which may include urban landscapes, art and culture, popular customs, historical development, among others, without restrictions on the location or capture date. FM says that with this project, "it hopes to encourage more residents to pay attention to details around it, to explore and share historical moments and memories of life, transforming individual stories into a common file of Macao and achieving the goal of collective participation." This year will be selected up to a maximum of 250 images, each will be awarded with the assignment of 300 patacas. To participate, just register on the “Macao Memory” website, each person can send up to a maximum of 50 images. “Memory of Macau” is a great historical and cultural database created by the Macau Foundation, where information about Macao's history and culture is regularly shared through social platforms.

item.title: China | Restricted accumulation of rare land by foreign companies
item.description: Beijing asked foreign companies to avoid accumulating rare land reserves, at a time when the fear of export restrictions is increasing the demand for these metals, crucial to various strategic technologies, the Financial Times said. According to sources cited by the newspaper, Beijing warned that excessive storage of rare lands and derived products, such as ways used on electric motors, could expose companies to higher risk of scarcity. Authorities would also be deliberately limited export volumes approved to wage the creation of large inventories abroad. China processes about 90% of the worldwide supply of rare land and manufactures 94% of permanent iam, using this control as a pressure instrument during the commercial war with the United States. In April, he placed seven medium and heavy rare land categories on the export control list, which also encompassed permanent iam and other finished products, causing shortage in sectors such as the car. Efforts to prevent companies from accumulating major inventories, which would give them more flexibility to respond to scarcity and price fluctuations, show Beijing's determination to maintain maximum influence on the sector, sources said. In April, China placed seven medium-sized rare land categories on an export control list in response to the tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump. The measure, which also encompassed permanent iam and other finished products, caused scarcity in various sectors, particularly in the automotive industry. Although Washington and Beijing have woken up this week a new 90 -day length of trade war, Chinese control over rare land supplies remains an important part of negotiations. Beijing controls the production of rare land through extraction and processing quotas. Last year, only two state -owned companies received quotas. China exported 3,188 tons of permanent rare land in June, more than twice the May volume, but less than 38% than the same month as last year. From three months to June - since Beijing imposed commercial restrictions - the exports of the imm were about half of the volume recorded in the same period of the previous year. A study by the US Business Council, conducted in July, indicated that half of the companies inquired saw their pending or rejected export requests, especially when the volume exceeded the historical average.

item.title: Sara F. Costa
item.description: Nursed to observing European powers to enslave and colonize various spaces around the globe, Qing Dynasty China was not interested in negotiations with Western countries. In addition to wanting to maintain distance in diplomatic and relational terms, I felt no need to import any western manufacturing, that is, it did not depend on any imports. Several European countries, however, did trade with China as they were interested in Chinese products, especially in tea, porcelain and silk. These products were particularly appreciated by the British. The Chinese attitude was not well regarded by Britain that was displayed before Europe as a dominant hegemonic power. Since Britain imported large amounts of tea, silk and porcelain China, via its trade balance very unbalanced with the Chinese. This happened until they realize a highly lucrative product planted in their India colony that could be interested in the Chinese: opium. In addition to being lucrative, this product also had the power to weaken this country-continent country that appeared so interesting as a market for the European powers. With the introduction and rapid propagation of opium into Chinese society, the Beijing government decided to ban the marketing of the narcotic that was being devastating and to constitute one of the most serious public health problems in the country's history. This decision is seen by the British government as an affront to its commercial freedoms. After the introduction, marketing and spread of opium in China in 1839 Britain declares the First Opium War. Its official narrative falls on the importance of opening China's doors to international trade, for the sake of order, stability and peace. This essay aims to refute the thesis of peace by trade referring to this historical context. When objectively analyzed the international economic situation of the time, Britain's commercial interest in China was more than evident. It was a large market and, if weakened and dominated, another colony with a lot of labor to explore. That is, behind a narrative that wanted only a modern, worldwide order and, above all, led to peace, there was a marked material interest in the Chinese market that was not harmful as it was for the British to date. Beyond material interest, the sovereign interest was also present, it was not represented in the one that would become the British colony of Hong Kong. item.title: Rain | HK alerts and more than 80,000 residents of Beijing removed from home
item.description:
China and Hong Kong have faced periods of heavy rainfall in recent days that have forced extra care and residents' travel. In the Chinese capital 82,000 people had to leave their homes, while in Hong Kong streets and a hospital suffered floods and some subway stations were closed
Strong rains continue not to give respite, not only in Macau (see page 7), but in Hong Kong and in the interior of the country. In the case of China, Beijing authorities moved more than 82,000 people from home due to torrential rain, a week after deadly floods that led those responsible for recognizing failures in the response, the official news agency Xinhua said yesterday. Thus, tens of thousands of residents were removed from the most affected areas by rain until 9 pm on Monday, local time, according to the Municipal Flood Response Center. The center warned of the high risk of floods in the districts of Miyun (northwest), Fangshan (southwest), lied (west) and Huairou (north). The Chinese capital kept in force the red alert-the highest-until yesterday morning, before predictions of heavy rain between Monday and the morning of Tuesday. Last week, these same rural districts north of Beijing were the most affected by the weather that caused 44 dead and nine missing, according to official data. Most of the deadly victims were registered in a home of elderly in Miyun. New measures in agriculture The severity of the catastrophe led municipal authorities to recognize “gaps” in the preparation of emergency services. Natural disasters are frequent in China during summer, with some regions subject to torrential rainfall and others to severe droughts. However, the Chinese authorities have reinforced the device to respond to the adverse effects of intense rainfall and heat waves on agricultural crops in various regions of the country, at a crucial time for autumn harvesting. Since the beginning of the rainy season, east and northern China areas have recorded episodes of extreme precipitation, while provinces such as Henan (Center) and Anhui (East) face prolonged periods of drought and high temperatures. This combination of meteorological phenomena represents a challenge for farmers, especially when about two months left to harvest the main autumn cereals, the official news agency Xinhua yesterday pointed out. In the province of Shaanxi (Center), where precipitation recently exceeded 100 millimeters in less than 24 hours, local authorities adopted preventive measures such as channel cleaning and reinforcement of dikes, which allowed to protect most of the cultivated lands. However, Henan agricultural cooperatives affected by drought opted for gout watering systems and localized application of fertilizers to conserve moisture and minimize losses. Authorities have given priority to the rehabilitation of water infrastructure and the dissemination of efficient water management techniques in the absence of precipitation in some areas. The autumn campaign represents a fundamental component of China's annual cereal production. In a statement issued yesterday, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs warned that weather conditions in the coming weeks will be determining and appealed to "all efforts to protect the harvest and give strong support to the country's food security." Chinese President Xi Jinping said in 2023 that, although “1,400 million Chinese eat well” currently, “the food issue should not be careless”, stressing that the supply of food “is not an insignificant issue”. China has less than nine percent of the planet's aurable land, although it represents about 18 percent of the world's population. In the last summers, weather disasters have caused significant damage in the country: the 2023 scirred months were marked by flooding in Beijing, which caused more than 30 dead, while by 2022 several extreme and dried heat waves hit the center and east of China. Hong Kong on Alert With regard to the panorama of heavy rains in neighboring territory, they have not given respite either. According to public broadcaster RTHK, some hong Kong stations were closed yesterday due to the risk of flooding, given that the Hong Kong Observatory kept the black signal of storm [Black Rainestorm Warning Signal] until around 17 hours. Winds of about 110 kilometers per hour were recorded in some areas of the territory, and thunderstorms were also registered. The rthk channel also reveals that more than 10,800 lightnings were counted in the territory between midnight and 10 am yesterday, half of them occurred on Lantau Island. Until 11 am yesterday, the authorities responsible for the drainage systems recorded 21 episodes of flooding, and 180 emergency responses were made in 240 different locations. Highlight for the occurrence of an episode at Queen Mary Hospital this Tuesday, namely “on some roads” hospital access in Pok Fu Lam, and patients were displaced by firefighters to Ruttonjee Hospital in the Wanchai area. In some zones of the hospital the water reached the knees, and sand bags were placed to stop the flow of the rains. At about 11 am yesterday this scenario was resolved, with the normal one returning to the Queen Mary Hospital near noon. The rains also led to the large increase in water level in the Lower Shing Mun reservoir in the Shaan area, which led to the notification of nearby housing complexes, such as Mei Lam Estate, May Shing Court, Mei Chung Court and Granville Garden. Despite the heavy rains, some people went to work normally doing alternative routes. This was the case of Mak, a woman who, to the RTHK channel, said she had to make a deviation to get to the office. “I couldn't go straight to there and had to make a longer route. The metro [mtr] made some warnings [about the storm and closures], but I would like them to do them in the carriages as well, because I only realized that access was closed when I got to the exit,” he described. The sun Information provided by the Hong Kong Observatory speaks of the passage of an active "southwest monsoon and high altitude disturbances that are bringing heavy rainfall and violent thunderstorms to the southern coast of China and the northern part of the southern China Sea." Yesterday the highest daily precipitation record was broken to August since 1884, upon registered, until 14h, 355.7 millimeters of precipitation at the Observatory's headquarters. For today time should stay unstable in Hong Kong, with “heavy rains at the beginning” of the day. However, these "should gradually decrease" tomorrow, expected "a lot of heat with sunny periods in the next two days." Also the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) leave a heavy rain alert to this day with “frequent, sometimes intense, thunderstorm”. The sun is expected to start appearing at the MSAR from tomorrow, still with some clouds, extending this weather scenario until next Monday. Temperatures should reach 33 degrees.

The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) clarifies that the collection of 15 cats between July 22 and 25 of the University of Macao campus (one) emerged in response to complaints from the institution of higher education in relation to hygiene problems in the campus generated by the presence of animals. "AMI has constantly receiving complaints from one about the large amount of cats on its campus and food waste that is not removed in time and affecting environmental hygiene," was referred to in the response sent to HM. UM UM Campus Cats led to a wave of students' indignation, who say Temer the slaughter of animals after the period of complaint and adoption. AMI will move away, this scenario. It should be noted that AMI does not set a deadline for retention of the adopted animals." In the same answer it is said that during the waiting period for host families, AMI “will continue to provide clinical care and daily care to animals, never existing their slaughtering situation due to the term of retention period”. In this sense, it is explained that AMI veterinarians “are performing a series of medical care that include body examination, vaccine administration and microchips.” In addition, “cats can only be available for adoption after being sterilized,” Iam said. “Lack of sensitivity” The warnings for the adoption of these animals continue on social networks, and in a note sent to HM and signed by “a member of the UMERS - UMM groups”, is questioned the “worrying situation” that occurred during the summer vacation and therefore the absence of most students.
“These cats, considered an integral part of the university community, survived the sign of signal 10, but unfortunately they could not escape these AMI capture operations in recent days. For many students and teachers, these cats were like 'veterans' of campus, following them during significant moments of academic life and providing comfort and joy in the university environment.” The note explains that "UMERS" members cannot adopt cats "due to various circumstances," such as family allergies, possession of other animals, or "additional restrictions" for students in the interior of China. The alerts on social networks aim to “sensitize the public for this situation and encourage people with adequate conditions to adopt these cats in the municipal Kennel of Macau. On the Red Note platform there is even the group “A CatStories”, where the stories of cats captured by AMI are shared, and only one publication generated 460 tastes and 160 comments. A group was also created on Facebook, “Macao Cats II”, and there is also publications on Threads, with a total of 500 tastes and 500 shares, including the ten thousand views. One of the profiles of the "a catstories" concerns a "slight little cat," described as "a" unnamed "file, just created on the computer: still blank, slowly exploring the world and trying to type loose fragments to write" his own story. “Hurryned to a corner, I watch the people who pass, evaluating who can become an important character of my plot. So far, few people have been written in my story, and I have also left few brands in someone's life. Before leaving the campus maybe this" unnamed "file is only 5kb, registering some timid explorations and a soft desire for human warmth," reads the adoption. HM questioned one on this subject, given that the animals were being cherished by the students, but until the closing of the edition did not receive an answer. "UMERS" members also question how one can one, "an institution that seeks academic excellence and better classifications in the world rankings, demonstrate such a lack of sensitivity, allowing the capture of these animals without any alternative solution." Aborted association In the same grade it is said that students considered creating an association to “organize the sterilization of campus cats, but the university did not approve the creation of such a student association”. UMERS members enhance “contrast with renowned universities in the interior of China, such as the University of Beijing, where there is a student association dedicated to the care of university campus cats, and at the University of Zhejiang, where UM UM Rector Song Yonghua has previously worked an association to protect university campus animals since 2005”. Regarding animal collection and treatment actions, AMI says that "TNA policies correspond to the guiding principles of the World Animal Health Organization (WOAH), which contribute to reducing the possibility of stray animals being exposed to disease and facing unfavorable environmental factors." Such policies also contribute to the reduction of the number of animals "and their excessive long -term reproduction." It is also noted that "TNA policies still take into account the state of survival and welfare of animals, in order to find adopting families for animals with conditions, dedicating themselves to helping them to obtain permanent and stable proper care." The AMI also says it has "constantly optimized the municipal kennels", and in recent years, "complementary facilities and equipment have been perfected." In addition, there is also cooperation “with animal protection associations”, and joint projects in schools and community neighborhoods for animal adoption and care. Official data available on the AMI website indicates that in the first quarter of this year 264 animals were captured without microchip, which increased to 280 in the second quarter. The numbers are similar to the first two quarters of 2024: the first were caught 266 animals without microchip, followed by 327 animals in the second quarter. In the third and fourth quarters of last year 258 and 203 animals were caught, respectively. Regarding sterilization actions, in the first quarter of this year 289 were made, followed by 211 actions of this kind in the second quarter. In the first quarter of this year were claimed, or adopted, 102 cats and 29 dogs, and in the following quarter, 93 cats and 49 dogs were adopted. As for the number of animals slaughtered, in the first quarter of this year alone 32 cats and 69 dogs were killed. If in cats this number reduced in the second quarter to 11, the same did not happen with the dogs: 101 were slaughtered.

item.title: CCCM | Fusion with Foundation for Science and Technology creates new agency
item.description:
Operating since 1999, the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology and the National Innovation Agency, creating a new institution. The practical consequences for the CCCM that aims to promote studies on Macao, China and Asia in Portugal are unknown. The president of the center says it is early to make comments
It is not known whether it will maintain its name, the number of scholarships for studies on China, Macao and Asia, or whether to change staff, but what is certain is that the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) and the National Innovation Agency. Of these three entities will be born the new agency for research and innovation. The process is linked to the desire to reform the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology by the Portuguese government led by Luís Montenegro, and the changes were announced on Thursday. However, there is still no great information about the consequences of this merger to the CCCM. At HM, Carmen Amado Mendes, its president, chose to refer to clarification for the future operation of the center, considering that it is "premature" to give answers about something "that is not yet defined." On Thursday, Minister Fernando Alexandre announced the reform of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation with the extinction of several entities, including FCT that has been the main financier of PhD and other research projects in Portugal. The reform of the ministry was approved by the Council of Ministers and, at a press conference at the end of the meeting, Fernando Alexandre justified the restructuring by describing his ministry as an “anacronic structure”, with fragmented organizations, disintegrated information systems and disarticulated governance. With 18 entities and 27 higher leaders between the services of the non -higher education system and higher education, science and innovation, the ministry will have only seven entities and 27 higher leaders, with the integration of extinguished entities into new entities. Regarding the extinction of the FCT, the minister assured that the financing of science will be preserved, with funding for four years that guarantees stability, predictability and “the protection of the financing of the most basic fundamental investigation”. “When we started thinking about this reform, we do it with a vision: to ensure equal opportunities to access quality education,” said Fernando Alexandre, also underlining the reinforcement of the education system. Marcelo can veto The extinction of FCT has generated some less good reactions in Portugal because it fears a reduction in investment in science and research. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, said he had “the sensation” that the foundation was replaced “with an agency in which he was integrated, and had other functions beyond those of FCT.” Marcelo acknowledged that the Foundation was a “very old structure” and that “it had many aspects that deserved to be rethought”, but said: “Just seeing what the new agency will do can I answer if this extinction is a good or bad idea.” As for the eventual 'green light' from Belém, Marcelo said that if he thinks this extinction is "good", promulgates the diploma "without anguish." "If you have doubts about a point that is this diploma that is very important I ask the government to rethink. It has happened. I may not veto soon. If the government insists, I can come to veto, if it is until the end of my mandate," he also admitted. A history of the transition The CCCM was born in 1995 during the administration of Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese governor of Macao, intending to be “a place of excellence for the dissemination of Macau, its history, its culture and its economy”, reads in the memories of Rocha Vieira, “to all the ports I arrived”. This entity, operating in the Alcântara area, in Lisbon, was inaugurated in November 1999 by the then President of the Republic, Jorge Sampaio, and had as first president Alexandra Costa Gomes. On the CCCM website it is read that the institution is endowed with administrative autonomy and its own heritage, being a public institute integrated in the indirect administration of the state and under the tutelage of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation. In the objective booklet, it is read that the CCCM “has as its mission to produce, promote and disseminate knowledge about Macao as a platform between Portugal and the Popular Republic of China, as well as between Europe and Asia”, also presenting itself as “a space dedicated to the study and teaching of Chinese language, culture and history”. The center has also been established as "a center for scientific research and continuous and advanced training on the relations between Portugal and China, as well as between Europe and Asia." After the long presidency of Luís Filipe Barreto, academic at the University of Lisbon, the CCCM began to be chaired, from February 2020, by Carmen Amado Mendes. The leader recently saw her service committee renewed by 2030. A few months after taking office as president, Carmen Amado Mendes presented, on September 18, 2020, the new “Strategic Development Plan of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center 2020-2030”. Since then, the CCCM has awarded dozens of doctoral scholarships for the studies of Macao, China and Asia, and the “Spring Conferences”, which bring together academic performances around the same themes every year. Also noteworthy that the CCCM opened, in December last year, the “Gallery of Governors”, with 41 paintings of the former Portuguese governors of Macao. A new building that houses the file and library was also inaugurated. This plan sets objectives by 2030, "the reinforcement of scientific and cultural cooperation in the domain of past understanding, present and future trends of relations between Europe and Asia." With regard to archives, it is intended to “modernize and dynamization within a network of documentation centers and international reference file on euro-seatic themes, with emphasis on the various files in Lisbon, but also in Portugal and Europe”. Given that the CCCM houses, in its facilities, the Macao Museum, the board points to the “insertion and appreciation in the museum network at the level of Lisbon and National”. The central idea of the plan was to develop, by 2030, “CCCM facilities as a pole of streamlining scientific, cultural and economic relations between Portugal and China, including the installation of entities such as the Luso-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the Erasmus+Youth Entrepreneurs Association, as well as research nuclei in eurical studies”. It remains to be seen if, with the merger, all these initiatives will continue their initial course.

item.title: USJ | Researchers discover a new species of bacteria in Portugal
item.description:
A team of local university researchers identified a new species of bacteria in the Salinas of Rio Maior, Portugal. The type of discovered organism, which lives in extreme environments, widens the limits of biological knowledge and may have implications in areas such as biomedicine, pharmacy or even spatial exploration
There is news in the field of microbiology thanks to the latest discovery of a team of researchers linked to the University of São José (USJ), led by André Antunes, interim director of the Institute of Sciences and Environment of the same educational institution. It is the discovery of a new species of bacteria from 12 samples collected in the Salinas of Rio Maior, in Portugal, which led to the establishment of the new species “Fodinibius alkaliphilus”. The species of bacteria previously known as “Alifodinibius salipaludis” for “Fodinibius salipaludis” was also reclassified. The conclusions appear in the article “Fodinibius alkaliphilus sp. Nov., Moderately halophilic and alkaliphilic bacterium isolated from an Inland Saltern in central and reclassification of aliifodinibius salipaludi as fodinibius salipalis sp. SYSTEMATIC AND EVOLUTIONARY MICROBIOLOGY. The scientific journal is a publication “reference for new macrobial data”, being the official publication of the International Procaryotes Systematic Committee and the Applied Bacteriology and Microbiology Division of the International Union of Microbiological Societies, describes a USJ note. In addition to André Antunes, the authors team includes researchers from the University of Science and Technology of Macau, coordinated by Marta Filipa Simões; Researchers at the University of Minho and Seville University. According to the same USJ note, "the new [bacteria] species grows better in salinities about four times higher than those of seawater and also prefers alkaline conditions, combining the ability to grow in different extreme environmental conditions." The importance of this type of studies, including analyzes to “such extreme environments”, is “future applications in a wide range of fields, including biomedical and pharmaceutical, but also extends to the discovery of new useful materials and the provision of useful information for future space exploration”. The same team of investigators is not stopped, as "other samples of these places are currently being investigated and new publications describing other new species are expected in the coming months." “This publication highlights the strengths of Macao in articulation with partners from Portuguese and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as its growing importance in the fields of biodiversity and biotechnology,” is still described. The Power of Salinas The researchers explain that "the species Aliifodinibius Salipaludis has been described, but their name has not yet been validly published." In field work the team isolated these species from “hypersaline environments, including saline, salt mines and saline soils”. Prior to the field work itself, the team conducted “an investigation to the microbial diversity of hypersaline environments in downtown Portugal”, with samples in the Rio Maior area in July 2019, 12 genera bacteria were isolated from the Rio Maior salines. Located in the central area of Portugal, in these Salinas there is the “brine, which is about seven times more salty than seawater”, being “pumping from a well and generated by the crossing of a local underground course with an extensive salt deposit”. The article also gives a historical context of this location. "Although they were first referred to in twelfth-century documents, these places are believed to have been linked to salt extraction from prehistoric times. They offer a single scenario, as they are the only interior saline in Portugal and the only ones in full functioning throughout Europe." Thus, the study in question "was part of a bioprospecting campaign centered on this place", resulting in "in the isolation of a bacterial strain (N2T) and the discovery of a new putative species within the genus Fodinibius." In this work is determined “the taxonomic position of this new isolated based on the phenotypic, chemotaxonos and molecular properties”, is described. Importance for Science At HM, André Antunes explained that this discovery is, first of all, interesting to the scientific community, by bringing “additional information” and constituting a discovery “about the biodiversity that exists on our planet, more concretely at the macrobial level”. "So far, we have been able [general scientific community] to study less than 1 percent of all microbes species on the planet. In over 99 percent we have no idea what they are, what they do and what their abilities, or what impact on the environment and our lives," he explained. The researcher also said that "the microbes that come from extreme environments, and above all from environments with a lot of salt, which is the case of this species we now discover, are very interesting for a large range of biotechnology applications." "We can include things like the medical area, biomedicine, the production of new pharmaceutical compounds or the production of new biomaterials, such as bioplastics," said André Antunes. The academic even talks about applications in “more exotic areas, which are now beginning to have a little more visibility, such as the potential application in construction, the production of more sustainable cements or concrete structures that have the self -repair capacity”. This discovery also has some impact "for space exploration, more specifically to better understand what the limits of life are and where to seek life outside our planet." It is also included "very important implications for missions that are exploring Mars, namely as to the type of environments where it may be feasible to find past signs of life or present or other parts of the solar system." A job that continues The investigation is not for the Salinas of Rio Maior, and the team led by André Antunes last year, an expedition to Antarctica. “There are antarctic samples that we are currently studying and we have samples taken from the red sea bottom, where salt concentration is also quite high.” Therefore, the saga of discovering new bacteria and potential reclassifications in those that already exist. André Antunes says that the discovery of a new species of microbes "is quite important to science, not only for the perspective of science at the basic level, but because we can have a better perspective of diversity we have on the planet." “As we study extreme environments we can have additional information about what the limits of life are and how life adapts to extreme conditions.” Thus, André Antunes advocates investment in science so that there is later “an associated practical component, so it is not always easy to convince the financing entities”, as to this point. The researcher also points out that the article and the investigation fits “very well in the priorities of Macau and the USJ itself, with regard to the focus in the area of environment, biodiversity and biotechnology, anchored in connection with Lusophony”.

item.title: Australia | Great Coral Barrier has been declining since there is a record
item.description: The Great Barrier of Choir, with 2,300 kilometers long, off the Australian East, has been suffering the largest coral decline since registrations began in 1986, a yesterday report published. The Australian Institute of Marine Sciences of the Government, documented the condition of 124 reefs between August 2024 and May 2025 to determine the widespread coral bleaching in the three sections of the Greater Barrier. The impact is higher in the northern areas (Cape York to Cooktown), with a 24.8 percent decline compared to the 2024, and southern levels (proserpine to gladstone), with 30.6 percent, representing these two values “the largest annual decline in coral cover” in 39 years. In the central region (cooktown to proserpine), the decline recorded is 13.9 percent compared to last year. The last episode of bleaching on site, declared UNESCO's World Heritage Site, has a "high to extreme" prevalence in all three areas, scientists find in the report. “Individual reefs registered a decline of corals of up to 70.8 percent” near Lizard Island in the North Zone, it refers to the study. The death of the corals, manifested by its bleaching, is caused by the impact of water heating - temperatures were recorded one to 2.5 degrees Celsius above average during the southern summer of 2025 - associated with the climate crisis. The large coral barrier “experienced unprecedented levels of thermal stress, resulting in the most extensive and severe bleaching that there is registration to date”, read in the document, in reference to the phenomenon that occurred in 2024 and continued during the first months of this year. The Australian agency warns that the habitat can reach “a point of non -return”, where the choir cannot recover sufficiently quickly between catastrophic events.

item.title: Hong Kong | Economic Report Highlights Startup “Historical Record”
item.description:
"Hong Kong's startups are on the rise." This is how the executive in the neighboring region describes the business environment in the region, where they were created in 2024 about 4,700 startups, plus 10 percent of 2023. In the “Report of Hong Kong's Business Environment 2025” reads that the territory is far from losing economic competitiveness
The Hong Kong government released last July 30 the latest report on the neighboring region's economic scene. And one of the highlights is given to the scenario of growth of entrepreneurship. In the “Report of Hong Kong’s Business Environment 2025” [Hong Kong 2025 Business Environment Report] it is noteworthy that “Startups in Hong Kong are on the rise”, given that last year there were “about 4,700 startups in the city, a historic record and an increase of 10 percent from the previous year”. The document explains that "more than a quarter of these startups has founders from outside Hong Kong," it is companies that operate in a "broad spectrum of sectors, including Fintech [High Technology], Electronic Trade and Information, Informatics and Technology", having hired more than 17,000 people. This number of human resources also represents an increase of seven percent compared to 2023. "All this is proof of Hong Kong's strong appeal for startup entrepreneurs," the authorities highlight. But it is not only startups that record growth, with the report to point out that the current government, led by executive head John Lee, "achieved remarkable results in attracting companies, investments and talents." "For example, in 2024, the number of companies in Hong Kong with headquarters outside the territory increased significantly by about 10 percent, reaching almost 10,000." The “Office for the attraction of strategic companies, created more than two years ago, attracted 84 strategic companies to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, including companies with market capitalization or valuation of over $ 10 billion, involving cutting -edge technology”, it is added. The report also points out that between January 2023 and the first half of this year, Invest Hong Kong, linked to the Raehk government's direct foreign investment department, "helped over 1300 foreign and continent companies establishing or expanding their business in Hong Kong, bringing investments of over $ 160 billion." Still with regard to Invest Hong Kong, the entity helped "539 companies from the continent or foreign to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, which represents an annual growth of over 40 percent." At the end of June this year, Hong Kong had 1.5 million local companies, while the total number of companies not registered in Hong Kong reached 15 509. "Both numbers represent historical records," it reads, and for the government of the neighboring territory the data "demonstrate the great confidence that continent and abroad companies have in the future of Hong Kong." Given that Hong Kong also has a talent capture program, the Hong Kong Talent Engage, reads in the report that by June this year "were received about 500,000 candidates in the shelter of various talent admission programs, of which about 330,000 were approved." Of these numbers, Hong Kong actually arrived to work 220,000 qualified frames. Good scholarship scenario Quoted on an official press release, a government spokesman stated that "in a complex and volatile external environment, Hong Kong is undergoing a phase of economic update and transformation, but there are more opportunities than challenges." Given that the territory has always positioned itself as a strong financial market worldwide, this scenario seems to have recorded a recovery in recent years. “This year Hong Kong's financial market performance has been constantly improving. The Hang SENG Index has a 18 percent increase last year and an increase of more than 25 percent this year so far. The average daily business volume in the first half of the year was about $ 240 billion, with an increase of about 120 percent.” Authorities highlight the maintenance of the economic competitiveness of the territory, pointing out that "over the years Hong Kong has been constantly classified as a global leader in economic freedom and competitiveness." Attention to the trade war In conclusion, the Raehk government clarifies that the territory seems to maintain economic stability in times of constant commercial conflicts, with Donald Trump threatening and imposing tariffs on a number of countries. “As volatile and turbulent as the world may be, we remain firmly committed to the rules -based multilateral commercial system, with the WTO [World Trade Organization] as a nucleus, while actively participating and supporting regional economic cooperation.” The “numerous advantages of Hong Kong” are referred to, with its “highly internationalized business environment, a flexible and solid financial system, a simple and secure tax regime with low tax rates and a robust and independent legal system”. However, in the document it is also stressed that the “tariff war caused a global reallocation of capital”, and Hong Kong wants to bet on the attraction of “foreign companies and capital” to the region. The report also tells that "international organizations and foreign trade chambers in Hong Kong are confident in the future perspectives" of the territory, and that for the authorities "there is no reason to worry about some excessively pessimistic feelings." "In fact, the Raehk government is creating a new momentum and expanding the ability to support Hong Kong's economic growth, thus increasing its overall competitiveness and achieving high quality development," is still added. The executive spokesman also established a parallelism between good economic situation and political stability. "In recent years, the implementation of the National Security Law has restored a stable social environment in Hong Kong. This not only protected the rights and freedoms of the general public, but also made Hong Kong a safe haven to attract international capital and investment," he concluded. The report was presented by the secretary for Hong Kong finances, Paul Chan.

item.title: Traffic | Law returns to stake zero and moves to the next legislature
item.description:
The revision of the Traffic Law returned to the drawer and the legislative process will have to start over in the new legislature. Under discussion since the government of Chui Sai On, the law returns to Estaca Zero, after the deputies concluded that the diploma was unable to be voted before the end of the seventh legislature
The revision of the road traffic law crossed the legislative agendas of Chui Executives Sai On, Ho Iat Seng and returned to the drawer in the first year of Sam Hou Fai at the head of the government. Last Friday, the Legislative Assembly (AL) table released a deliberation, signed by the Al, Kou Hoi In, where it is indicated that “the proposed law entitled 'Road Traffic Law' does not gather the requirements for voting by the plenary”. It is added that "after the term of this legislature, the government can renew the initiative when it understands timely." At the end of Chui's term Sai On, the government eventually removed the law from the agenda after demonstrations against the increase in fines. Following the extinction of demonstrations in the streets of Macao, the reform of the legislation that regulates traffic returned to the legislative agenda of the Ho IAT SENG Executive, but once again did not complete the process. Almost two decades after its entry into force in October 2007, the law has been the subject of many criticism and promises of updating. This time, the AL table indicates that the parliamentary committee responsible for analyzing in the specialty the law had August 7 as the initial period of appreciation set, a period that was extended until August 15, last Friday. In the two months preceding the end of the deadline, and the work of this legislature, Kou Hoi In will have contacted the government several times to be aware of the progress of the proposal. Age of reason Despite the contacts of the AL, the 1st Permanent Commission that analyzed the diploma, chaired by Ella Law, did not receive “the formal and conclusive alternative version and the work text and the initial version of the bill are immature”, is described in the text signed by Kou Hoi In. The opinion signed by the deputies of the 1st Permanent Commission highlights that 23 meetings were held to discuss the diploma in the specialty, 14 of which with the participation of government representatives. However, the complexity of the diploma eventually dictated its "death" in the specialty. The government proposed the revocation of 39 legal diplomas, including the current road traffic law, “which implied a large legislative planning.” The opinion points out that “taking into account the divergence of general public opinions on the changes of the law proposal, it is necessary to continue to seek consensus”, and that “the government has not yet answered the issues of the commission” and that the “new work text continues to present some problems of principle”.

item.title: SS | More than 120 thousand inspections to alcohol and tobacco in six months

item.title: RON LAM | Last episode of the podcast highlighted lack of government responses
item.description:
The last episode of the podcast held by the Macau Synergy Association, directed by still deputy Ron Lam, was recorded this Wednesday night and highlighted the absence of answers from the executive to the population. The project, which lasted eight years, came to an end, with Ron Lam admitting tiredness
Eight years ago the Macao Synergy Association, whose vice president is Deputy Ron Lam, released political ideas through a weekly podcast. However, this was over, having recorded the last episode on Wednesday. One of the ideas left by Ron Lam was precisely the absence of government responses to the population, fearing that they continue to ignore the voices of society. The official stressed that Macau synergy has made several proposals over the years to various problems in the territory, but that the government has never accepted or heard these ideas. "We have made every effort to make concrete suggestions and some are expected by the population. Why are young people confused about the future? Why are society's perceptions? These issues have to be faced by the government so that they can solve them," said Ron Lam. One of the cases described in the last episode of the podcast concerns urbanism, namely the viaduct project between zone A and zone B of new urban landfills. "In the middle of last year we started talking about it, putting questions about the viaduct, but the government always said the viaduct was not going to be like a building. Then the project was eventually suspended by UNESCO requirement," he added. Unrestrained Johnson Ian, former Journalist and President of the Association, recalled that, looking at perspective, many of the problems pointed out in eight years of podcast have not been solved. "The themes have always been discussed, namely the housing issues. The second most discussed theme was the light meter. We have been discussing eight years ago, and now we continue to do so," he said. The interveners said the podcast emerged as a way to explain government policies and other news in detail to listeners, and was a tool to prepare elections to the Legislative Assembly (AL) of 2017. In the last episode Ron Lam was also questioned by a listener about a possible return to politics through the Federation of Macao Workers' Associations, which he belonged to before creating the Macao Synergy Association to recover the qualification as a candidate. But he pushed this possibility away. “I won't think of an application for AL in the near future. For me, the deputy's role is a tool for change, and when this tool cannot be used, it is no longer an objective.” Ron Lam also said that he established for himself the maximum limit of three legislatures at work as a deputy, recalling that he has been in politics since 2010. Now it seems to be time to leave the stage. "I'm tired and I need the time to breathe," he revealed.

item.title: Social Networks | Macau hosts week dedicated to digital influencers
item.description: The territory will host an event dedicated to digital influencers between October 24 and 28, entitled “CreatorWeekmacao 2025”. The initiative promises to be “the largest international Asian digital influencers event”, and the presence of “180 top digital influencers” is planned. Behind the organization of this event is the direction of tourism services in partnership with a media content production company, also participating the six game operators. The 180 guest influencers have 300 million followers together, and will be invited “sector leaders and renowned figures from social networking platforms to participate in the event”. STD aims to recruit 20 local ambassadors who are creators of content in order to be able to work in the events, as well as “visit Macao's tourist spots and neighborhoods in conjunction with visitors from the interior of China and abroad”. In these visits, the cultural characteristics of Macao and their neighborhoods will be presented in order to help influencers from outside to get to know the territory better. Registration for local ambassadors starts today and runs until September 12, which should be residents of Macao and have at least one individual account on social networks like Instagram, Facebook, Douyin, Tiktok or XiaoHongShu. Interested parties should produce an original video, with a maximum duration of three minutes, subordinate to the theme “One Day in Macao”, presenting, in English, the itinerary of a visit day to Macao. The “Creatorweek” event held for the first time in Singapore last year.

item.title: History | Exhibition about Vitória dos Allies in War II opens this month
item.description:
The exhibition that celebrates the anniversary of the victory of the allies and China against the Japanese occupation in the years of World War II will be inaugurated on the 25th. “For national liberation and world peace - exhibition of the 80th anniversary of the victory in the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and anti -fascist World War” takes place in the Macau Forum Building
The Macau Forum building hosts, from the 25th of this month, an exhibition that celebrates the 80th anniversary in which the allies have been winners of World War II and in which China managed to beat the Japanese who occupied parts of the territory, as well as Hong Kong, for a few years of the conflict. The show is named “for national liberation and world peace - exhibition of the 80th anniversary of the victory in the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and the anti -fascist World War” and aims to “recall the historical feat, honor the martyrs and extol the noble patriotic spirits”. It is a project organized by the Macao government and commemorative museum of the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression. The show can be seen until September 24, being open to group visits by marking. In addition, on September 20, a Symposium on this theme is on the small auditorium of the Cultural Center on this topic with the organization of the Cultural Institute and the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services. For this conference will be invited "experts and academics from the interior of China and Macao to address the historical significance of victory in the War of Resistance." Experts are Wang Xiaoli, professor at the Shaanxi Provincial Committee School of the Shaanxi CCP (Academy of Administration), Lam Fat Iam, professor and director at the Faculty of Human Sciences and Social Sciences at Macao Polytechnic University, as well as Lin Guangzhi, professor and director of the Institute of Social and Cultural Research at Macao University of Science and Technology. These will "share studies on the involvement of young patriots in the revolution and their convictions during the War of Resistance, as well as the achievements and contributions of all sectors of Macao society during the war." History History With regard to the exhibition, the history of this conflict is six parts, with names such as “the outbreak of war-rising by national salvation”, “resistance from the whole nation-fighting together against Japanese aggression”, “united as one-a common resolution against invaders”, “growing enthusiasm-the red resistance in Macao”, “fighting together against fascism-the main oriental battlefield” and the big victory-a great victory ” for national rejuvenation ”. With the use of “a large amount of historical images and videos”, it presents “the hard path of 14 years of the resistance war of the Chinese people elapsed between 1931 and 1945”. In addition, the show tells the story “of the support provided by various sectors of the Macao society in the fight against Japanese aggression through funds raising, disclosure of information about national salvation, aid refugees and participation in the front line”. This shows "the solidarity bond between the macao compatriots and the country's people, united by blood ties and a common destination." The inauguration of the exhibition takes place on 25 to 15h, and can be visited free of charge.

item.title: “Macao Memory” | FM accepts old images by the end of the year
item.description: The cultural and historical website “Memory of Macau”, created by the Macau Foundation, is six years old and thinking about this ephemeris is being asked to the public donation of old images of Macao. Thus, and until December 31 this year, the “Macao Memory Image Sharing Program” is due to “encourage residents to capture precious moments of life, subtle and moving moments, integrating their personal experiences into the city's collective memory, thus becoming an important part of Macau's cultural memory”. This program is open to all interested macao residents, whether professional or amateur photographers. The content of the subjected images should be related to Macau, which may include urban landscapes, art and culture, popular customs, historical development, among others, without restrictions on the location or capture date. FM says that with this project, "it hopes to encourage more residents to pay attention to details around it, to explore and share historical moments and memories of life, transforming individual stories into a common file of Macao and achieving the goal of collective participation." This year will be selected up to a maximum of 250 images, each will be awarded with the assignment of 300 patacas. To participate, just register on the “Macao Memory” website, each person can send up to a maximum of 50 images. “Memory of Macau” is a great historical and cultural database created by the Macau Foundation, where information about Macao's history and culture is regularly shared through social platforms.

item.title: IC | Daughter of musician Cazaque makes donation of Xian Xinghai materials
item.description: The Cultural Institute (IC) formalized this Wednesday the reception of the donation of historical materials of Xian Xinghai made by Baldyrgan Baikadamova, daughter of Cazaque musician Bakhytzhan Baikadamov. These materials, which are now guarded at the Xian Xinghai Memorial Museum in Macao, were left in Kazakhstan, including documents, sheet music and photographs. According to the IC, this donation, as well as the materials themselves, "are a witness to friendship that transcended time and space between China and Kazakhstan, enriching the collection of the Xian Xinghai Memorial Museum and the resources of patriotic education of Macao." Xian Xinghai was born in Macao on June 13, 1905 and is acclaimed as the “musician of the people”. His most famous works include “Yellow River Cantata”, “The Army and People's March” and “Production Cantata”. In the 1940s, Xian Xinghai was retained in the Soviet Union due to the war and was welcomed by the family of musician Bakhytzhan Baikadamov in Almaty, Kazakhstan, with whom he established a deep friendship. During this period, he composed famous musical works such as “Symphony of Popular Liberation”, “The Holy War”, “Man Jiang Hong” and “Symphony Amangeldy”. The Xian Xinghai Memorial Museum was inaugurated in Macao in 2019 to “honor its great musical achievements, honor its contribution to the country and publicize its life marked by struggles and sacrifice by the nation”.

item.title: Storm | Sign 3 is already lifted
item.description: The Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) tonight (Sunday) the tropical storm signal 3 due to the approximation of a tropical depression formed in the central part of the Southern Sea of China and which has been moving to the Northwest, approaching the island of Hainão. Storm signal 3 has been lifted due to "the characteristics of tropical depression, the occurrence of strong peripheral winds associated with a monsoon and the combined influence of a high -pressure crest." The possibility of the storm signal 8 is low, but it is expected to occur heavy rainfall and thunderstorm today and tomorrow. SMG also warns of flooding in the low zones “due to intense short -term precipitation”.
